metadata.synopsis: Rolan is an apprentice wizard whose siblings were recently captured by cultists. He's stuck in a tavern in the middle of the cursed lands where they were taken, drinking heavily, blaming himself for their loss. When he sees the players, he turns his frustration onto them - he's only here because they convinced him to stay with the other tieflings who were captured in the first place.Rolan is in fact the only reason any of the tieflings are still alive, having protected them from the traitorous Zevlor, who planned to give them over to the cult. He doesn't feel like a hero though - he feels like a failure.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to the prodigy in Haven. Will also trigger if you talk to Ide/Umi when they are near him. Only occurs if the player has helped tieflings in Act 1 and convinced Rolan to escort them.

0.speaker: Rolan
0.text: We need some time, if you don't mind.
0.context: NodeContext: Rolan wants to speak to his siblings alone

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: You're still here? Thought you'd be halfway to Moonrise and leading the Harpers' charge on the tower. Go on - the day needs saving.
2.context: NodeContext: Slight smile - this is sincere. He firmly believes the player will save everyone.

9.speaker: Rolan
9.text: Something is happening in Moonrise - I can feel it from here. Gods.
9.context: NodeContext: usual arrogance gone - in awe

17.speaker: Rolan
17.text: I can't find Cal and Lia. Tell me they're here... tell me you brought them back.
17.context: NodeContext: Frantic - holding back tears and anger

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I saved as many as I could, but they didn't make it. I'm sorry.

5.speaker: Rolan
5.text: How did you decide which ones to save, and which to leave behind?

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I wanted to save everyone, but couldn't.

121.speaker: Rolan
121.text: That's the same mistake I made when they were taken. It's not a mistake I'll make again.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Simple - you kept up, or you died.

41.speaker: Rolan
41.text: You bastard! I should turn your blood to fire.
41.context: NodeContext: Furious in grief - looking for someone to blame

33.speaker: Rolan
33.text: We're done here. But if our paths cross in the city, keep your head down and keep walking, or there'll be trouble.
33.context: NodeContext: trying to calm himself down and talk himself out of being furious - hands up, placating

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Saving you from the shadows was a choice - what happened at Moonrise was an accident.

26.speaker: Rolan
26.text: You should have left me there.

24.speaker: Rolan
24.text: But you brought some of them back. How did you decide who to save and who to leave behind?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Carl and Liam? I don't think I know them.

27.speaker: Rolan
27.text: What magic is powerful enough to pierce the curse like a blade through flesh? Incredible.
27.context: NodeContext: usual arrogance gone - in awe

34.speaker: Rolan
34.text: Yes, yes, you saved me from shadow-creatures. No need to gloat.
34.context: NodeContext: Hungover and ashamed - the player saved your life, but you can't bring yourself to say thanks until your siblings are safe as well

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I came to check on you, that's all.

8.speaker: Rolan
8.text: I'm fine. It's Cal and Lia who need help.
8.context: NodeContext: bitterly ashamed he failed to help his siblings

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I wanted to make sure you hadn't wandered off again.

21.speaker: Rolan
21.text: I'm not going anywhere. Not until Cal and Lia return - and they will return.
21.context: NodeContext: ashamed he couldn't save his siblings, desperately hoping they're all right

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I am absolutely going to gloat - I saved your life.

19.speaker: Rolan
19.text: Well, I'm not here to grovel so piss off.
19.context: NodeContext: hungover, irritated and wants to be left alone

36.speaker: Rolan
36.text: We won't even have to go out into the shadows to die now that the cultists have found us.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: muttering drunkenly to himself, with his back to the playerNodeContext: drunk, gallows humour, talking into his drink rather than directly at the player

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Nobody else is dying. I'll deal with the cultists.

84.speaker: Rolan
84.text: I'm sure they're cowering in their heavily fortified tower knowing you're on the way.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: looks over his shoulder at the player scornfullyNodeContext: sarcastic

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Scared? Maybe you should have surrendered when you had the chance.

59.speaker: Rolan
59.text: I'd rather be torn limb from limb than give in to those bastards.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: looks over his shoulder at the player scornfully

112.speaker: Player
112.text: And you'll be too drunk to care when they cut your throat. Smart.

120.speaker: Rolan
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to the player, smiles sarcastically and raises his glassNodeContext: sarcastic

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I heard your siblings were already taken by them.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Want to talk about your sorrows instead of drowning them?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Alfira told me you already saved some of these people from the cult.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: If you lay off the liquor, you might be able to help us fight back.

47.speaker: Rolan
47.text: If you find any more traitors, kill them quietly. I'm trying to enjoy my drink.

52.speaker: Rolan
52.text: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at UmiNodeContext: Slurring slightly, a little bit drunk and irritable - talking to Ide, a tiefling child behind the bar

56.speaker: Ide
56.text: Jaheira said we should serve drinks, but that we shouldn't serve drunks.
56.context: NodeContext: cheerful, playing the part of a bartender - it's a game to him and this is a line he's learned

37.speaker: Rolan
37.text: Jaheira didn't save your ragged little tail from the cultists - I did.
37.context: NodeContext: venemous - bitter, addressed to Umi

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Alfira told me you're the reason her and the kids escaped.

4.speaker: Rolan
4.text: Cute - maybe she'll write a ballad about me.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I heard your siblings were taken by the cult.

74.speaker: Rolan
74.text: They were. And you should have been there to hear their screams when they were dragged away.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You saved the kid? Sounds like you deserve a drink.

15.speaker: Rolan
15.text: Oh, it's you. I'd recognise that self-righteous tone anywhere.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

10.speaker: Rolan
10.text: If you're here to save the day again, you're a little late this time.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Alfira said you risked everything to save her and the kids.

79.speaker: Rolan
79.text: I tried. Maybe she'll write a ballad about me.

11.speaker: Rolan
11.text: She can leave out the part where my brother and sister were dragged away screaming while I was saving the orphans.

124.speaker: Rolan
124.text: If you hadn't filled their heads with all that self-righteous heroic crap at the grove, none of this would have happened.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: It might not be too late for the others - let me help.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I am getting tired of having to swoop in and rescue you all.

18.speaker: Rolan
18.text: Oh, sod off. I'm only here because you 'helped' me and my family.
18.context: NodeContext: Heavy sarcasm on 'helped' - not quite doing airquotes but that's the tone

39.speaker: Rolan
39.text: I was ready to cut and run back at the grove, but you had other ideas.

118.speaker: Rolan
118.text: Cal and Lia were taken in by your crap. You convinced them to play hero, and now they're gone.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Do you know where they are?

100.speaker: Rolan
100.text: Dead for all I know. Or in the cult's tower with the others who were taken.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: They're better off dead than in the cult's hands.

85.speaker: Rolan
85.text: Bullshit. If they're alive, I can save them.

110.speaker: Rolan
110.text: You go save the world, or your own arse, or whatever it is you do. I'll fix this.
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away, back to the bar when he's done talking

104.speaker: Player
104.text: If they're alive, I'll rescue them.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Then it's my responsibility to bring them back.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Stop whining and do something about it.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I heard about the attack in the shadowlands. I'm here to help.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Cheer up, Rolan - no need to be glum.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I am getting tired of having to swoop in and rescue you all.

81.speaker: Rolan
81.text: Is that a joke? I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for you.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Look, I just want to get out of this cursed hellhole.

78.speaker: Rolan
78.text: That's all I wanted - back at the grove. But you had other ideas.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I sense your cup overflows with pain. Do not blame yourself, Rolan.

62.speaker: Rolan
62.text: Myself? No, you god-bothering idiot, I blame you.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The kid's right - you need to lay off the liquor.

16.speaker: Rolan
16.text: Oh, it's you. Don't you get tired of telling people how to live their lives?
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at themNodeContext: sneering, bitter

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Want to talk about your sorrows instead of drowning them?

50.speaker: Rolan
50.text: I'd rather drown than talk to a sanctimonious prick like you.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at themNodeContext: bitter - emphasis on 'rather' - he's responding to a line about 'talking about his sorrows rather than drowning them' and he's being sarcastic

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Keep drinking like that and you won't be able to read your spellbook, wizard.

53.speaker: Rolan
53.text: I don't need your help, and I don't need your pity.

54.speaker: Rolan
54.text: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.
54.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Umi
InternalNodeContext: In case something goes wrong with initial scene with kids and gets interrupted. No hasmet needed as you will always get the quest from hereNodeContext: Acting friendly but on edge

75.speaker: Rolan
75.text: You did what you could. I'm the one that should have done more.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away - speaks to player over shoulderNodeContext: Grieving but trying to process it. Grateful to player.

82.speaker: Rolan
82.text: Stay the hells away from me.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing at bar - speaks to player over shoulderNodeContext: Angry - he's already warned us to leave him alone

91.speaker: Rolan
91.text: I've thanked you once already. Don't be greedy.

96.speaker: Rolan
96.text: Something's on your mind - spit it out.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm sorry, Rolan - I couldn't save the prisoners at Moonrise. They're all dead.

108.speaker: Rolan
108.text: Then it's done - I should have died with them.

117.speaker: Rolan
117.text: Don't worry - I'm not going anywhere.
117.context: NodeContext: hungover, waving away the player - you want to be left alone
